title: 114_hr3945
content: The Act titled "Improving Opportunities for Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses Act of 2015" aims to enhance contracting opportunities for certain veteran-owned small businesses. The Small Business Act is amended to define a small business concern owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans as one where at least 51 percent is owned by service-disabled veterans. A small business concern owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans must have at least 51 percent ownership by service-disabled veterans with a permanent and total disability. A small business concern owned by service-disabled veterans must have at least 51 percent ownership by service-disabled veterans, with exceptions for surviving spouses acquiring ownership interest in the concern after the death of a service-disabled veteran owner. A small business concern owned by service-disabled veterans must meet specific criteria, including having at least 51 percent ownership by service-disabled veterans and being included in a database specified in title 38, United States Code. The time period after a veteran's death for the surviving spouse ends upon remarriage, relinquishing ownership in the business, or 10 years after the veteran's death. Additionally, definitions for ESOP and surviving spouse are provided. The term 'surviving spouse' is defined in section 101(3) of title 38, United States Code. Section 8127 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to clarify the definition of 'small business concern owned and controlled by veterans' as per the Small Business Act. The term 'small business concern owned and controlled by veterans with service-connected disabilities' is defined in the Small Business Act. Amendments are made to clarify this definition in section 8127 of title 38, United States Code. Amendments are made to the Small Business Act to include small business concerns owned and controlled by veterans with service-connected disabilities. The Small Business Act is amended to include the definition of 'small business concern owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans' in contracts. SEC. 3. Regulations regarding the Secretary of Veterans Affairs' database. Amendments are made to Section 8127(f)(4) and Section 8127(f) of title 38, United States Code, regarding the use of Small Business Administration regulations for verifying small business status. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is prohibited from issuing regulations related to small business status and ownership. The effective date of these amendments is delayed. The Small Business Administration and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs will issue regulations implementing the amendments within 18 months of the Act's enactment. SEC. 4. APPEALS OF INCLUSION IN DATABASE. The text chunk discusses the process for appealing the denial of verification for inclusion in a database for small business concerns owned and controlled by veterans. The appeal can be made to the Office of Hearings and Appeals of the Small Business Administration, and the decision of the office is considered final agency action. The appeal process for small business concerns owned and controlled by veterans with service-connected disabilities is heard by the Office of Hearings and Appeals of the Small Business Administration, with the decision being final agency action. Interested parties include the Secretary and contracting officers. The Secretary is responsible for reimbursing expenses for each fiscal year. The Secretary will reimburse the Small Business Administration for expenses incurred by the Office of Hearings and Appeals, with the amount determined jointly and funded from fees collected under multiple-award schedule contracts. Any disputes will be resolved by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. This provision applies to verification decisions made by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs after the enactment of this Act.
